channel.title: Posts on Eva and Colin's World Trip
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Eva and Colin's World Trip

item.title: nz north island
item.description: New Zealand is a unique place. And it’s significant in that it marks a halfway point for us.

item.title: tonga
item.description: Heading west after the New Year, we stopped for a week in Tonga, a small south pacific kingdom consisting of more than 170 tiny islands.

item.title: holidays in the states
item.description: For Christmas and New Years, we stopped in some (mostly) unfamiliar places for a chance to see some familiar faces.

item.title: bogotá & medellín
item.description: Long before we arrived in Colombia, it was a constant topic of discussion: should we stay in Bogotá or Medellín? In the end, we made Bogotá the primary home base for our travels, but we snuck in a visit to Colombia’s second biggest city, too.

item.title: teyuna
item.description: In the second century A.D., the Tairona people built a city in what is today the Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta mountains, on Colombia’s Caribbean coast. At the top of 1200 winding stone steps, 180 stone terraces were carved and built into the mountainside, straddling a waterfall. We climbed those steps too.

item.title: providencia
item.description: After our first week in Bogotá, we made a short trip to Providencia, a Carribean island belonging to Colombia off the eastern coast of Nicaragua.

item.title: atacama
item.description: From the border with Bolivia, we plunged all the way down to 2,400 meters above sea level, to the Chilean Atacama Desert.

item.title: bolivian altiplano
item.description: Leaving Patagonia’s snow-covered peaks and wind-swept pampas behind, we headed for desert and volcano in Bolivia’s altiplano.

item.title: patagonian roadtrip
item.description: Since leaving Torres del Paine, we’ve made our way slowly north by car, crossing the Chilean/Argentinean border three times and covering over 2000km of southern and central Patagonia.

item.title: torres del paine
item.description: There are many national parks in Patagonia. Of course, we picked the most impressive one as our first destination.

item.title: buenos aires
item.description: We’re in Buenos Aires, Argentina, our first stop.

item.title: shipping off soon
item.description: On September 30th, we’ll be on our way! Keep an eye on this space for updates.
